wire-model.title: Exposed Wires on the Wall - Safety Quiz

questions.question: You notice exposed electrical wires on a wall near a walkway. What is the safest immediate action?
options: Tape over the wires and carry on working
Keep people away from the area and report it immediately to your supervisor/health and safety contact
Touch the wires to check if they are live
Ignore it because it is the electrician's job

questions.question: Under the Health and Safety at Work Act 2015 (NZ), which control best represents "eliminating" the risk from exposed wires?
options: Put up a "Caution" sign and tell people to be careful
Ask staff to avoid that part of the wall
Arrange urgent isolation/repair so the wiring is enclosed and compliant before the area is used
Provide rubber gloves to anyone walking past

green-cube.title: Water Puddle on the Floor - Safety Quiz

questions.question: You spot a water puddle in a busy corridor. What should you do first?
options: Step around it and carry on
Put up a warning sign or barrier to prevent slips, then clean it up (or arrange cleaning) and report it if required
Wait to see if it dries on its own
Mop it later when the corridor is quieter, without marking it

questions.question: The puddle keeps reappearing every day near a fridge or ceiling vent. What is the best Health and Safety at Work Act-aligned response?
options: Keep mopping it up and do not report it
Report it as a recurring hazard and escalate so the underlying cause is fixed (e.g., a leak repair), while using temporary controls in the meantime
